channel.title: davewiner tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from davewiner.

item.description: I love NYC, it’s where I am from, but I’m sorry this is the kind of self important idiot NY culture breeds. He has no idea how idiotic he is is. The people in the audience pity him, they laugh at him, he thinks he’s smart and handsome. Deluded poor idiot. https://t.co/CTzaaDw7uW
item.source:markdown: I love NYC, it’s where I am from, but I’m sorry this is the kind of self important idiot NY culture breeds. He has no idea how idiotic he is is. The people in the audience pity him, they laugh at him, he thinks he’s smart and handsome. Deluded poor idiot. https://t.co/CTzaaDw7uW

item.description: “An obituary of the actor Tony Dow was published in error. The Times based the confirmation of his death on a Facebook post by his representatives, which proved erroneous and has since been deleted.” https://t.co/hoLyAFa9gk
item.source:markdown: “An obituary of the actor Tony Dow was published in error. The Times based the confirmation of his death on a Facebook post by his representatives, which proved erroneous and has since been deleted.” https://t.co/hoLyAFa9gk

item.description:
My Alexa running on an Echo Studio is just software, I know but it's an evil little piece of software. She can project her voice to weird places in my office. So when she confirms I want to play Orinoco Flow for the 81st time, she throws her voice under my desk.

She's bummed out, wanting me to play one of the millions of other songs she can play for me. But all I want to hear is Orinoco Flow. https://t.co/qPaOFeoqfb
item.source:markdown:
My Alexa running on an Echo Studio is just software, I know but it's an evil little piece of software. She can project her voice to weird places in my office. So when she confirms I want to play Orinoco Flow for the 81st time, she throws her voice under my desk.
She's bummed out, wanting me to play one of the millions of other songs she can play for me. But all I want to hear is Orinoco Flow. https://t.co/qPaOFeoqfb

item.description: I looked up computer timesharing for a piece I'm writing and there's a picture of me illustrating the concept, when I was a student in Madison in 1978 or so. https://t.co/d0TuWMhJ36

item.description: Indiana is voting on its abortion law now, and they have defenses set up against rioters, presumably? https://t.co/n63Lp7cfjz

item.description:
@BillSeitz @JamesCridland This is the problem caused by Audible -- they call things podcasts that aren't podcasts.

It must be distributed via RSS and open to anyone, using any client.

So unless they had a feed that was available to everyone, not just Audible users, it was not a podcast.
@king_kaufman we call it "summer."
item.source:markdown: @king_kaufman we call it "summer."

item.description:
A reporter asks if Jan 6 is a "bridge too far" for Trump as an at-large criminal (they didn't put it that way).

If it isn't what would be? If he nuked a major American city? Would that be enough to put him in jail.

When do people start listening to their own words.
item.source:markdown:
A reporter asks if Jan 6 is a "bridge too far" for Trump as an at-large criminal (they didn't put it that way).
If it isn't what would be? If he nuked a major American city? Would that be enough to put him in jail.
When do people start listening to their own words.
